messages.title: Re-Elect Mary Glindon
messages.content: Since I first stood for election I have never taken a single vote for granted. I have worked hard over the last seven years to keep my pledge to be a strong local voice for North Tyneside in Parliament and to do all I can to make life better for everyone who lives here, whether helping to bring 2,000 jobs to the Tyne or helping an individual with their tax query. My values have never changed, I want to see a fairer and more just society. I have always been honest and have an unblemished political record. I have always put my constituents first and my party second and whilst my Party’s leaders have come and gone in the last seven years, the Labour Party remains firmly rooted in its core values. I promise you that, if re-elected I will continue to fight for North Tyneside with determination, passion and conviction.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: I have lobbied many ministers directly, via questions and in debates on issues including the pasty tax, the Independent Living Fund and Economic Funding.

I have backed the work of our Elected Mayor, Norma Redfearn, and North Tyneside Council, by playing my part in the regeneration of North Tyneside and most recently by objecting to the unfair cuts the Government is imposing on all our schools.

We are facing tough times ahead as the next government will have to negotiate our country’s exit from the EU. if re-elected, my priority will be to ensure the best deal for the people of North Tyneside from the forthcoming negotiations.

issues.brexitEurope: We are facing tough times ahead as the next government will have to negotiate our country’s exit from the EU.
issues.economy: Independent Living Fund and Economic Funding

community.content: I have backed the work of our Elected Mayor, Norma Redfearn, and North Tyneside Council, by playing my part in the regeneration of North Tyneside and most recently by objecting to the unfair cuts the Government is imposing on all our schools.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have always cared about North Tyneside as a resident, as a councillor in Battle Hill for 15 years and in my role as MP. I was born here and most of my family live here, so everything that happens in North Tyneside affects people I love.

politicalExperience.achievements: I have helped thousands of people with their individual problems through my active constituency office. I have spoken up in Parliament and put questions to the Prime Minister on issues ranging from access to cancer treatment to asking for support for our fabrication industries on the Tyne.

contactInformation.address: North Tyneside Labour Freepost NEA 9534, NE12 9BR

examples: In 2010 you sent me to Parliament with a large majority. In 2015 I was re-elected with a bigger majority of 17,194, 56% of all the votes cast.
I have helped to bring 2,000 jobs to the Tyne.
I have always cared about North Tyneside as a resident, as a councillor in Battle Hill for 15 years and in my role as MP.
My values have never changed, I want to see a fairer and more just society.
We are facing tough times ahead as the next government will have to negotiate our country’s exit from the EU.
I have always been honest and have an unblemished political record.
I have always put my constituents first and my party second and whilst my Party’s leaders have come and gone in the last seven years, the Labour Party remains firmly rooted in its core values.
I promise you that, if re-elected I will continue to fight for North Tyneside with determination, passion and conviction.
I hear loud and clear the needs of the area and work hard to ensure they are met.
I was born here and most of my family live here, so everything that happens in North Tyneside affects people I love.
Independent Living Fund and Economic Funding

I have backed the work of our Elected Mayor, Norma Redfearn, and North Tyneside Council, by playing my part in the regeneration of North Tyneside and most recently by objecting to the unfair cuts the Government is imposing on all our schools.
I promise you that, if re-elected I will continue to fight for North Tyneside with determination, passion and conviction.
I have lobbied many ministers directly, via questions and in debates on issues including the pasty tax, the Independent Living Fund and Economic Funding.
I have spoken up in Parliament and put questions to the Prime Minister on issues ranging from access to cancer treatment to asking for support for our fabrication industries on the Tyne.

We are facing tough times ahead as the next government will have to negotiate our country’s exit from the EU. if re-elected, my priority will be to ensure the best deal for the people of North Tyneside from the forthcoming negotiations.

I was born here and most of my family live here, so everything that happens in North Tyneside affects people I love.
